committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Asian and Pacific Affairs

official_title: A concurrent resolution to establish a Congressional Commission to be known as the "Perot Commission on Americans Missing in Southeast Asia" to determine whether or not U.S.  POWs are being held in Southeast Asia and to report to Congress appropriate action to effect the release of any POWs found to be alive.

summary.text: Establishes in the legislative branch of the Government the Perot Commission on Americans Missing in Southeast Asia to conduct an investigation and report to the Congress its findings with respect to the existence and the release of prisoners of war in Southeast Asia. Sets forth specified administrative procedures and powers of the Commission. Requires the Commission to terminate 30 days after the filing of its report to the Congress or on January 3, 1987, whichever occurs first.

titles.title: A concurrent resolution to establish a Congressional Commission to be known as the "Perot Commission on Americans Missing in Southeast Asia" to determine whether or not U.S.  POWs are being held in Southeast Asia and to report to Congress appropriate action to effect the release of any POWs found to be alive.
